instantiate.title: InstantiateMsg
instantiate.description: This structure describes the parameters used for creating a contract.

owner.description: Address allowed to change contract parameters

vesting_managers.description: Initial list of whitelisted vesting managers

vesting_token.description: [`AssetInfo`] of the token that's being vested

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

AssetInfo.description: This enum describes available Token types. ## Examples ``` # use cosmwasm_std::Addr; # use astroport::asset::AssetInfo::{NativeToken, Token}; Token { contract_addr: Addr::unchecked("stake...") }; NativeToken { denom: String::from("uluna") }; ```

execute.title: ExecuteMsg
execute.description: This structure describes the execute messages available in the contract.

oneOf.description: Claim claims vested tokens and sends them to a recipient

amount.description: The amount of tokens to claim

recipient.description: The address that receives the vested tokens

oneOf.description: Receives a message of type [`Cw20ReceiveMsg`] and processes it depending on the received template
Creates a request to change contract ownership ## Executor Only the current owner can execute this

expires_in.description: The validity period of the offer to change the owner

oneOf.description: Removes a request to change contract ownership ## Executor Only the current owner can execute this
Claims contract ownership ## Executor Only the newly proposed owner can execute this
Adds vesting managers ## Executor Only the current owner can execute this
Removes vesting managers ## Executor Only the current owner can execute this

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

Cw20ReceiveMsg.description: Cw20ReceiveMsg should be de/serialized under `Receive()` variant in a ExecuteMsg

VestingAccount.description: This structure stores vesting information for a specific address that is getting tokens.

address.description: The address that is getting tokens

schedules.description: The vesting schedules targeted at the `address`

VestingSchedule.description: This structure stores parameters for a specific vesting schedule

end_point.description: The end point for the vesting schedule

start_point.description: The start date for the vesting schedule

VestingSchedulePoint.description: This structure stores the parameters used to create a vesting schedule.

amount.description: The amount of tokens being vested

time.description: The start time for the vesting schedule

query.title: QueryMsg
query.description: This structure describes the query messages available in the contract.

oneOf.description: Returns the configuration for the contract using a [`ConfigResponse`] object.
Returns information about an address vesting tokens using a [`VestingAccountResponse`] object.
Returns a list of addresses that are vesting tokens using a [`VestingAccountsResponse`] object.
Returns the total unvested amount of tokens for a specific address.
VestingState returns the current vesting state.
Returns list of vesting managers (the persons who are able to add/remove vesting schedules)

OrderBy.description: This enum describes the types of sorting that can be applied to some piece of data

migrate.title: MigrateMsg
migrate.description: This structure describes a migration message. We currently take no arguments for migrations.

available_amount.title: Uint128

config.title: ConfigResponse
config.description: This structure describes a custom struct used to return the contract configuration.

owner.description: Address allowed to set contract parameters

vesting_token.description: [`AssetInfo`] of the token that's being vested

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

AssetInfo.description: This enum describes available Token types. ## Examples ``` # use cosmwasm_std::Addr; # use astroport::asset::AssetInfo::{NativeToken, Token}; Token { contract_addr: Addr::unchecked("stake...") }; NativeToken { denom: String::from("uluna") }; ```

vesting_account.title: VestingAccountResponse
vesting_account.description: This structure describes a custom struct used to return vesting data about a specific vesting target.

VestingInfo.description: This structure stores parameters for a batch of vesting schedules.

released_amount.description: The total amount of vested tokens already claimed

VestingSchedule.description: This structure stores parameters for a specific vesting schedule

end_point.description: The end point for the vesting schedule

start_point.description: The start date for the vesting schedule

VestingSchedulePoint.description: This structure stores the parameters used to create a vesting schedule.

amount.description: The amount of tokens being vested

time.description: The start time for the vesting schedule

vesting_accounts.title: VestingAccountsResponse
vesting_accounts.description: This structure describes a custom struct used to return vesting data for multiple vesting targets.
A list of accounts that are vesting tokens

vesting_state.title: VestingState
vesting_state.description: This structure stores the accumulated vesting information for all addresses.

total_granted.description: The total amount of tokens granted to the users

total_released.description: The total amount of tokens already claimed
